meta-review.comment: Jak and Daxter: The Lost Frontier takes players on a solid platforming adventure with a touch of wacky humor, but it could have used some extra polish to truly soar. Despite some archaic gameplay elements and occasional camera issues, the game delivers gratifying gameplay reminiscent of the series' roots. The unfriendly skies and impressive Lost Frontier make it a worthwhile addition to the Jak universe, offering challenging puzzles and solid portable platforming action. While it may not be essential for plot progression, it's a satisfying continuation for fans craving the classic Jak and Daxter experience.
